results.question: List all employees in the Sales department
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.* FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id WHERE d.name = 'Sales' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many employees were hired in 2024?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM employees WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM hire_date) = 2024;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: What is the average salary by department?
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, AVG(e.salary) AS avg_salary FROM departments d LEFT JOIN employees e ON d.department_id = e.department_id GROUP BY d.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all customers with credit limit over $100,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.* FROM customers c WHERE c.credit_limit > 100000;

results.question: How many sales orders are in pending status?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM (SELECT * FROM sales_orders WHERE status = 'pending') AS pending_sales_orders LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all products in the Electronics category
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.* FROM products AS p JOIN product_categories AS pc ON p.category_id = pc.category_id WHERE pc.name = 'Electronics' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the names of all warehouses?
results.sql_generated: SELECT w.name FROM warehouses w LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all active vendors
results.sql_generated: SELECT v.* FROM vendors v WHERE v.is_active = true LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different account types in the chart of accounts?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT a.name FROM account_types a JOIN chart_of_accounts c ON a.type_id = c.account_type_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all bank accounts and their current balances
results.sql_generated: SELECT b.account_number, b.account_name, b.bank_name, b.current_balance FROM bank_accounts b LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many projects are currently active?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM projects WHERE status = 'active' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all fixed assets with their purchase cost
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.asset_id AS asset_id, fa.name AS name, fa.purchase_cost AS purchase_cost FROM fixed_assets fa LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are all the available leave types?
results.sql_generated: SELECT lt.name FROM leave_types lt LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all training courses that are mandatory
results.sql_generated: SELECT tc.* FROM employee_training et JOIN training_courses tc ON et.course_id = tc.course_id WHERE tc.is_mandatory = true LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different opportunity stages?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT stage_id, name FROM sales_opportunities LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all countries in the system
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.name FROM countries AS c LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many departments are there?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM departments LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all units of measure
results.sql_generated: SELECT uom.* FROM units_of_measure AS uom LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What fiscal years exist in the system?
results.sql_generated: SELECT fy.year FROM fiscal_years fy LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different asset categories?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT category_id FROM fixed_assets LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find employees who have been with the company for more than 5 years and earn above $100,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.* FROM employees e JOIN employee_salaries s ON e.employee_id = s.employee_id WHERE termination_date IS NULL AND salary > 100000 LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List employees and their managers' names
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.first_name || ' ' || e.last_name AS employee_name, m.first_name || ' ' || m.last_name AS manager_name FROM employees e INNER JOIN employees m ON e.manager_id = m.employee_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Which employees have pending leave requests?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employees e JOIN leave_requests lr ON e.employee_id = lr.employee_id WHERE lr.status = 'pending' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show the number of employees per position title
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.title AS PositionTitle, COUNT(e.employee_id) AS NumberOfEmployees FROM positions p INNER JOIN employee_salaries e ON p.position_id = e.salary_id GROUP BY p.title LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find employees with expiring certifications in the next 6 months
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.* FROM employee_salaries s JOIN employee_certifications c ON s.employee_id = c.employee_id AND s.effective_date <= CURRENT_DATE AND (s.end_date IS NULL OR s.end_date > CURRENT_DATE) JOIN employees e ON c.employee_id = e.employee_id WHERE c.expiry_date BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND DATE_ADD(CURRENT_DATE, INTERVAL '6 months') LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total sales amount by customer for 2024?
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.customer_id AS customer_id, SUM(sales_orders.total) AS total_sales FROM sales_orders JOIN customers ON sales_orders.customer_id = customers.customer_id WHERE YEAR(sales_orders.order_date) = 2024 GROUP BY c.customer_id LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: missing FROM-clause entry for table "c"

results.question: List the top 10 customers by total order value
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.customer_id, SUM(po.total) AS customer_order_value FROM sales_orders po JOIN customers c ON po.customer_id = c.customer_id GROUP BY c.customer_id ORDER BY customer_order_value DESC LIMIT 10;

results.question: Show sales opportunities in the Negotiation stage worth over $50,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT s.* FROM sales_opportunities s JOIN opportunity_stages o ON s.stage_id = o.stage_id WHERE o.name = 'Negotiation' AND s.amount > 50000 LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the conversion rate from quotes to orders?
results.sql_generated: SELECT s.order_id AS "Order ID", COUNT(q.quote_id) AS "Quote Count", (COUNT(q.quote_id)/SUM(s.quantity)) * 100 AS "Conversion Rate" FROM sales_orders s JOIN quote_lines q ON s.order_id = q.order_id GROUP BY s.order_id LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column q.order_id does not exist

results.question: List sales orders by sales representative with their totals
results.sql_generated: SELECT s.sales_rep_id AS rep_id, COUNT(s.order_id) AS total_orders FROM sales_orders s GROUP BY s.sales_rep_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Which products have inventory below their reorder point?
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.product_id, p.name FROM products p INNER JOIN reorder_rules r ON p.product_id = r.product_id INNER JOIN inventory_levels i ON p.product_id = i.product_id WHERE i.quantity_available < r.min_quantity LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show total inventory value by warehouse
results.sql_generated: SELECT w.warehouse_id, SUM(i.quantity * i.quantity_on_hand) AS total_inventory_value FROM inventory_levels i JOIN warehouses w ON i.location_id = w.warehouse_id GROUP BY w.warehouse_id LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column i.quantity does not exist

results.question: List products that had stock transfers in the last 30 days
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.sku, p.name FROM products p INNER JOIN transfer_lines tl ON p.product_id = tl.product_id INNER JOIN stock_transfers st ON tl.transfer_id = st.transfer_id WHERE st.transfer_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '30 days' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total spend by vendor this year?
results.sql_generated: SELECT v.vendor_id, SUM(vi.amount) AS total_spend FROM vendor_invoices vi JOIN vendors v ON vi.vendor_id = v.vendor_id WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM fiscal_years.start_date) = EXTRACT(YEAR FROM CURRENT_DATE) GROUP BY v.vendor_id;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: List purchase orders that are overdue (expected date passed but not received)
results.sql_generated: SELECT po.* FROM purchase_orders AS po LEFT JOIN goods_receipts AS gr ON po.po_id = gr.receipt_id WHERE po.status = 'Open' AND po.order_date < CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '30 days' AND (gr.receipt_date IS NULL OR gr.receipt_date > po.expected_date) ORDER BY po.po_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show the approval rate for purchase requisitions
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(pr.requisition_id) FILTER (WHERE pr.status = 'Approved') / COUNT(*) FROM purchase_requisitions pr LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total debit and credit for each account in the current period?
results.sql_generated: SELECT ca.account_number AS account_no, ca.current_balance AS current_debit, 0 AS current_credit FROM bank_accounts ca WHERE ca.is_active = true LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all posted journal entries for the current month
results.sql_generated: SELECT j.entry_id, j.entry_number, j.entry_date, j.description, j.status FROM journal_entries AS j WHERE EXTRACT(MONTH FROM j.entry_date) = EXTRACT(MONTH FROM CURRENT_DATE) AND EXTRACT(YEAR FROM j.entry_date) = EXTRACT(YEAR FROM CURRENT_DATE);
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Show budget vs actual spending by department
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, b.total_amount AS budgeted_amount, SUM(p.actual_amount) AS total_spent FROM departments d LEFT JOIN budgets b ON d.department_id = b.department_id LEFT JOIN project_budgets p ON b.budget_id = p.budget_id GROUP BY d.name, b.total_amount LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total expense amount per project?
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.project_id, SUM(pe.amount) AS total_expenses FROM projects p JOIN project_expenses pe ON p.project_id = pe.project_id GROUP BY p.project_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List projects that are over budget
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.* FROM projects p INNER JOIN budgets b ON p.project_id = b.budget_id WHERE p.status = 'over_budget' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show project resources and their allocation percentages
results.sql_generated: SELECT r.employee_id AS employee_id, r.role AS role, r.allocation_percent AS allocation_percentage FROM project_resources r JOIN projects p ON p.project_id = r.project_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List fixed assets by category with their total purchase cost
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.category_id, SUM(fa.purchase_cost) AS total_purchase_cost FROM fixed_assets fa JOIN asset_categories ac ON fa.category_id = ac.category_id GROUP BY fa.category_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List assets due for maintenance in the next 30 days
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.* FROM fixed_assets AS fa JOIN asset_maintenance AS am ON fa.asset_id = am.asset_id WHERE am.completed_date IS NULL OR (am.completed_date > CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '30 days') AND fa.status = 'maintenance' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many documents are attached to each entity type?
results.sql_generated: SELECT entity_type, COUNT(*) FROM document_attachments d1 JOIN entities e ON d1.entity_id = e.id GROUP BY entity_type;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Calculate employee turnover rate by department for 2024
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, (COUNT(e.employee_id) / NULLIF(COUNT(DISTINCT e.employee_number), 0)) * 100 AS turnover_rate FROM departments d LEFT JOIN employees e ON d.department_id = e.department_id AND e.termination_date BETWEEN '2024-01-01' AND '2024-12-31' GROUP BY d.name ORDER BY turnover_rate DESC LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find the salary percentile ranking for each employee within their department
results.sql_generated:
SELECT e.employee_id, CONCAT(e.first_name, ' ', e.last_name) AS name, d.department_id, p.position_id, s.amount, (s.amount / SUM(s.amount) OVER (PARTITION BY e.department_id)) * 100 AS salary_percentile FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department
                    department_id JOIN positions p ON d.department_id = p.department_id JOIN employee_salaries s ON e.employee_id = s.employee_id GROUP BY e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name, d.department_id, p.position_id, s.amount LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: syntax error at or near "department_id"

results.question: Identify employees who have not completed mandatory training
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employees e LEFT JOIN employee_training et ON e.employee_id = et.employee_id AND et.status = 'completed' WHERE et.course_id IS NULL LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate month-over-month sales growth rate for the past 12 months
results.sql_generated: SELECT DATE_TRUNC('month', s.created_at) AS sale_month, SUM(s.total) / COUNT(*) OVER (PARTITION BY DATE_TRUNC('month', s.created_at)) * 100 AS monthly_growth_rate FROM sales_orders s WHERE s.status = 'Completed' AND s.order_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '12 months' GROUP BY sale_month ORDER BY sale_month LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find the average order value and order frequency for each customer segment based on credit limit
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.segment, AVG(s.total) AS avg_order_value, COUNT(*) / 365 AS order_frequency FROM customers c JOIN sales_orders s ON c.customer_id = s.customer_id GROUP BY c.segment LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column c.segment does not exist

results.question: What is the sales pipeline weighted value by stage and expected close month?
results.sql_generated: SELECT opportunity_stages.name AS stage, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM actual_close_date) AS month, SUM((sales_opportunities.amount * opportunity_stages.probability / 100) + (purchase_orders.subtotal * sales_opportunities.probability / 100)) AS weighted_value FROM sales_opportunities INNER JOIN opportunity_stages ON sales_opportunities.stage_id = opportunity_stages.id LEFT JOIN purchase_orders ON sales_opportunities.po_id = purchase_orders.id GROUP BY stage, month ORDER BY stage, month;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Calculate inventory turnover ratio by product category
results.sql_generated: SELECT pc.category_id, SUM(il.quantity_on_hand) / AVG(il.last_count_date::DATE - il.last_count_date + 1) AS turnover_ratio FROM inventory_levels il JOIN product_categories pc ON il.product_id = pc.category_id GROUP BY pc.category_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Identify products with significant inventory discrepancies (adjustment > 10% of stock)
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.product_id, p.name, i.quantity_on_hand, i.quantity_available, a.quantity_change, i.last_count_date FROM inventory_levels i JOIN products p ON i.product_id = p.product_id JOIN adjustment_lines a ON p.product_id = a.product_id WHERE a.quantity_change > (i.quantity_on_hand + i.quantity_available) * 0.1 LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate vendor performance score based on on-time delivery and invoice accuracy
results.sql_generated: SELECT v.vendor_id, AVG(CASE WHEN p.due_date >= i.order_date THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS on_time_delivery_score, AVG(CASE WHEN i.amount_paid = i.total THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS invoice_accuracy_score FROM vendors v JOIN vendor_invoices i ON v.vendor_id = i.vendor_id JOIN purchase_orders p ON i.po_id = p.po_id GROUP BY v.vendor_id LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column p.due_date does not exist

results.question: Generate a trial balance for the current period showing debits and credits by account category
results.sql_generated: SELECT acc_type.name AS "Account Category", SUM(ba.current_balance) AS Debit, 0 AS Credit FROM bank_accounts ba JOIN account_types acc_type ON ba.account_number = acc_type.type_id GROUP BY acc_type.name ORDER BY CASE WHEN acc_type.normal_balance = 'D' THEN 1 ELSE 2 END LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: operator does not exist: character varying = integer

results.question: Calculate cash flow from bank transactions grouped by transaction type and month
results.sql_generated:
SELECT transaction_type, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM transaction_date) AS month, SUM(amount * (1 - is_reconciled)) OVER (PARTITION BY transaction_type, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM transaction_date)) as cash_flow 
FROM bank_transactions 
JOIN bank_accounts ON bank_transactions.bank_account_id = bank_accounts.bank_account_id 
GROUP BY transaction_type, month;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Calculate project profitability comparing budget vs actual expenses
results.sql_generated: SELECT pb.project_id, SUM(pb.planned_amount) AS planned_total, SUM(pe.actual_amount) AS actual_total, (SUM(pb.planned_amount) - SUM(pe.actual_amount)) AS profitability FROM project_budgets pb INNER JOIN project_expenses pe ON pb.project_id = pe.project_id GROUP BY pb.project_id LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column pe.actual_amount does not exist

results.question: Find resource allocation by employee across all active projects
results.sql_generated: SELECT pr.project_id AS project_id, pe.employee_id AS employee_id, rr.role AS role, SUM(rr.estimated_hours) AS total_hours FROM project_resources AS rr INNER JOIN employees AS pe ON rr.employee_id = pe.employee_id INNER JOIN projects AS pr ON rr.project_id = pr.project_id WHERE pr.status = 'active' GROUP BY pr.project_id, pe.employee_id, rr.role LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column rr.estimated_hours does not exist

results.question: List all fixed assets with their assigned employees and current locations
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.*, e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name, e.email, e.phone, la.building, la.floor, la.room FROM fixed_assets AS fa JOIN asset_locations AS la ON fa.location_id = la.location_id JOIN employees AS e ON fa.assigned_to = e.employee_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Create a comprehensive employee cost report including salary and benefits by department
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, SUM(es.salary) AS total_salaries, SUM(ebs.amount) AS total_benefits, COUNT(*) AS num_employees FROM departments d LEFT JOIN employees e ON d.department_id = e.department_id LEFT JOIN employee_salaries es ON e.employee_id = es.employee_id LEFT JOIN employee_benefits eb ON e.employee_id = eb.employee_id GROUP BY d.name LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column es.salary does not exist
